Custodial Position Available, Heath Middle School

Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter to Mike Whittington at jwhittington@heath.k12.oh.us by June 30th, 2020.

Position: Day Shift Custodian

Salary: $16.61 - $25.13 per hour, based on experience (can only award 5 years of experience).
Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental and vision insurance and SERS retirement.

Qualifications:
Custodial experience is preferred
Punctuality and reliability required
Honesty and exceptional work ethic
Ability to solve problems independently
Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language
Must be 18 years of age or older
Physical Demands
Continual standing and walking during shift
Continual reaching with hands/fingers/arms during shift
Occasional climbing, balancing, kneeling and crouching during shift
Must be able to occasionally lift over 80 pounds
Will occasionally encounter toxic chemicals

Message about cold and flu season.

We have had an elevated level of absences in some buildings throughout the last week and a half. We are monitoring those levels and communicating with the school nurse and medical staff.

We take extra steps to disinfect all student areas during the winter months with a disinfectant that is sprayed on all surfaces, furniture and buses.

Some have asked if there is a trigger we use to make decisions about whether to have school based on illness. That answer is staffing, as long as we can staff a building, we will remain open. We encourage parents to keep their child home if they are sick, or have had a fever in the past twenty-four hours. Regular hand washing and hygiene is important. We appreciate your partnership as we strive to provide a safe and educational environment for your students.

Trevor Thomas
Superintendent

post_text: Yesterday Heath administrators were fortunate to tour manufacturing plants in Heath and Hebron. We MUST share that there are awesome opportunities for students and adults in the county right here in our backyard. The Port Authority, which is located in Heath has numerous companies on its grounds that provide jobs, and the average wage there is about $77,000.00 per year. We then toured THK and Covestro in Hebron. Both were large plants that offered hundreds of jobs to our area. They have a hard time filling their jobs because they can't find enough applicants. At Covestro alone, the opportunities ranged in salary from $50,000 - 180,000 per year. Most employees starting at Covestro have a high school education. There are GREAT opportunities in our area, but more of us need to be aware of them!

Garfield Elementary was (past tense) evacuated due to the smell of gas in the kitchen area. Heath Fire Department and Heath Police responded immediately. Heath Fire determined that there was not a gas leak, followed by an inspection from the Energy Cooperative that confirmed there was not a leak. We believe the cause was an initial use of a stove and a vent that was not activated immediately caused a brief smell of gas. Students were evacuated, but then returned once it was determined that the building was safe. This was a brief period of time.

In situations like these, we always communicate in as candid a manor as possible to parents and the community. I would like to emphasize however, that we can only communicate when we have information. We will always tell you what's up, but sometimes it take a few minutes.

Thanks as always to our wonderful safety forces, our amazing staff and our understanding parents and community!
